                    ### Question
                    Aldosterone action is on :

                    ### Options
                    opa. Proximal tubule
opb. Distal tubules
opc. Loop of Henle
opd. Collecting duct

### Enhanced Information (For Contextual Support):
Aldosterone primarily acts on the distal tubules of the kidney by binding to mineralocorticoid receptors, leading to increased sodium reabsorption and potassium excretion. This action helps regulate electrolyte balance and blood pressure. While aldosterone also affects the collecting duct, its primary site of action is the distal tubules.
